intro: Viguiera helianthoides, commonly known as Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Viguiera helianthoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in full sun with minimal water.
